result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Contrary to Injunction, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6-4-17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may not longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers. 
Restitution set at zero.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Successfully complete a Parenting Program.
Successfully complete an Anger Management Program.
Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Terrell Hunt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (31 pages) commencing 6/4/14 received and filed.

Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ AB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 21 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 151 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/4/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/4/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-Successfully complete an Anger Management Program
-Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program
-Complete 10 hours of community service
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing from the AM calendar resumed.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Bail remains the same.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing began, but was adjourned to the afternoon due to defense attorney not having all of the proper forms completed.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is in trial and there are no spin courts available. Case rescheduled for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Avery L. Goodrich in court, defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt not in court, in custody.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 4/23/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in court with attorney Avery L. Goodrich.  Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in custody.  Step Nolten for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Terrell Hunt
Current: 4406 N 82nd St, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 03-03-2014)
Prior: 3165 North Fratney Avenue Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jerome C. and Cynthia A.

Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in court with attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Defendant Brandon Terrell Hunt in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
